sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"drupal-8-modules"}}>{`Drupal 8 Modules`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Create `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`/web/modules/<module>/<modules.info.yml`}</MDXTag>{` and add some base info.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{}}>{`name: Hello World
description: A silly example module

type: module
core: 8.x

# if there are requirements
dependencies:
  - node
  - rest
  - system (>=8.2.0)
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"hooks"}}>{`Hooks`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`HOOK_entity_load()`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Generally you can place hooks into one of three categories:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Hooks that answer a question`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Hooks that alter existing data`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Hooks that react to an action`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`hook_form_alter()`}</MDXTag>{` is one of the most powerful hooks.`}</MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
